Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶

A simple root endpoint to test if the API is working correctly. Returns a simple message.

async main.startup()¶

This function is executed when the application starts. It connects to Redis and initializes the FastAPI Limiter for rate-limiting.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user with data entered by this user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to receive.

  • user (User) – The user to get contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a requested contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.read_birthdays(db: Session, user: User, days: int) → List[Contact] | None¶

Searches for users whose birthdays are within the next days specified by the user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to search contacts for.

  • days (int) – Number of days to search for birthdays.

Returns:

List of searched contacts or None if they do not found.

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async src.repository.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Removed contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(user: User, db: Session, name: str | None, surname: str | None, email: str | None) → List[Contact] | None¶

Searches for contacts for specified users based on the specified parameters.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to search contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • name (Optional[str]) – The name of the searched contact(s).

  • surname (Optional[str]) – The surname of the searched contact(s).

  • email (Optional[str]) – The email of the searched contact.

Returns:

List of searched contacts or None if they do not found.

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The data for the contact to update.

  • user (User) – The user to update contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

an updated contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms the user’s account creation by email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email by which the user will be searched.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing.

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a user with specified body parameters.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data to create user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves a user by specified email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email to search by.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email by which the user will be searched.

  • url (str) – Avatar image url.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a User with new profile image.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates refresh token for specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose refresh token is being updated.

  • token (Optional[str]) – Token to be updated.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing.

Return type:

None

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms the user’s email address by verifying the provided token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the success or failure of the email confirmation process.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the verification token is invalid or the email does not exist (400 Bad Request).

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticates a user and generates an access token and refresh token.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login credentials, including username (email) and password.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type (Bearer).

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is invalid, the email is not confirmed, or the password is incorrect (401 Unauthorized).

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refreshes an access token using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the new access token, refresh token, and token type (Bearer).

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid or expired (401 Unauthorized).

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Requests a new email confirmation for an unconfirmed email address.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The data containing the email address to request confirmation for.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending the confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – Request object, used to get the base URL for generating the confirmation link.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the success or failure of the email confirmation request.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Registers a new user and sends a confirmation email to the user’s provided email address. The user’s password is hashed before being stored in the database, and a background task is used to send a confirmation email with a verification token.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data required to create a new user.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending the confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – Request object, used to get the base URL for generating the confirmation link.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user and a message indicating the success of the operation.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already registered (409 Conflict).

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Creates a new contact for the currently authenticated user. The number of requests allowed per minute is limited to 5.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The created contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If an error occurs while creating the contact.

async src.routes.contacts.read_birthdays(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db), days: int = Query(7))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays for the currently authenticated user within a specified number of days. The number of requests allowed per minute is limited to 5.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • days (int) – The number of days ahead to check birthdays. Defaults to 7 days.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays within the specified range.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts have birthdays within the specified period (404 Not Found).

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a specific contact for the currently authenticated user by contact ID. The number of requests allowed per minute is limited to 10.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The requested contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found (404 Not Found).

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip. Default is 0.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Default is 100, but can be adjusted.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts belonging to the current user.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

Raises:

HTTPException – If an error occurs while fetching contacts from the database.

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Deletes a contact for the currently authenticated user by contact ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found (404 Not Found).

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db), name: str = Query(None), surname: str = Query(None), email: str = Query(None))¶

Searches for contacts for the currently authenticated user based on provided search criteria. The number of requests allowed per minute is limited to 5.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • name (str) – The first name of the contact to search for.

  • surname (str) – The surname of the contact to search for.

  • email (str) – The email address of the contact to search for.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search criteria.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts are found (404 Not Found).

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Updates an existing contact for the currently authenticated user by contact ID. The number of requests allowed per minute is limited to 5.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The contact data to update (including the contact’s name, surname, email, etc.).

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found (404 Not Found).

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves the profile information of the currently authenticated user.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The profile information of the current user.

Return type:

UserDb

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an error retrieving the user’s profile data.

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Updates the avatar’s profile picture of the currently authenticated user. The avatar image will be uploaded to Cloudinary, resized, and the public URL will be saved to the user’s profile.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The avatar image file to upload.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user information including the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserDb

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an error during the avatar upload process or user update.

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates an access token with the provided data and expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing the payload to be included in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time in seconds for the access token. If not provided, the token will expire in 15 minutes by default.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Creates an email verification token for the provided data.

Parameters:

data (dict) – A dictionary containing the data to be included in the email verification token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT email verification token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates a refresh token with the provided data and expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing the claims (payload) to be included in the refresh token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time in seconds for the refresh token. If not provided, the token will expire in 7 days by default.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decodes and validates a refresh token to retrieve.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode and validate.

Returns:

The email address associated with the refresh token if valid.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or its scope is incorrect.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves the current authenticated user based on the provided access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The access token used for authentication.

  • db (Session) – The database session used to query user information.

Returns:

The user associated with the token if valid.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the user does not exist.

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Decodes the provided email verification token and extracts the email.

Parameters:

token (str) – The email verification token to decode.

Returns:

The email address associated with the provided token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or cannot be decoded.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Hashes the provided plain text password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password to be hashed.

Returns:

The hashed version of the provided password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = <redis.client.Redis(<redis.connection.ConnectionPool(<redis.connection.Connection(host=localhost,port=6379,db=0)>)>)>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies if the provided plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password provided by the user.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password stored in the database.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends a confirmation email to the user with a verification token.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address to which the confirmation email is sent.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient user, included in the email message.

  • host (str) – The base URL of the host used to generate the confirmation link in the email template.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue connecting to the email service or sending the email.
